channel.title: Orthomolecular Health
channel.itunes:author: orthomolecularhealth.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: Orthomolecular Health Podcasts launched every two weeks between May and June 2009
channel.itunes:summary: Check out the Orthomolecular Health podcast series hosted by Charmaine Gooden, contributing editor of Zoomer magazine. Interviews with healthcare practitioners and patients explore this option in complementary medicine; how it works and how it can be used to treat and prevent various diseases such as MS, heart disease, schizophrenia and more.

item.title: Introduction to Orthomolecular Medicine

item.title: How Orthomolecular Medicine can help prevent and manage symptoms of Multiple Sclerosis
item.description: Check out the Orthomolecular Health podcast series hosted by Charmaine Gooden, contributing editor of Zoomer magazine. item.title: How Orthomolecular Medicine can help prevent and manage symptoms of Schizophrenia
item.description: Check out the Orthomolecular Health podcast series hosted by Charmaine Gooden, contributing editor of Zoomer magazine. The following podcast with Dr. Jonathan Prousky, ND and Expert Advisor to Orthomolecular Heath, and Rosalie Moscoe, Registered Holistic Nutritionist, whose son uses orthomolecular medicine in his treatment of schizophrenia, explores this option in complementary medicine; how it works and how it can be used to treat and manage various diseases such as schizophrenia.
